11#include <stdlib.h>
12#include <string.h>
13
14#include "vpx/vpx_image.h"
15#include "vpx/vpx_integer.h"
16#include "vpx_mem/vpx_mem.h"
17
18static vpx_image_t *img_alloc_helper(vpx_image_t *img, vpx_img_fmt_t fmt,
19 unsigned int d_w, unsigned int d_h,
20 unsigned int buf_align,
21 unsigned int stride_align,
22 unsigned char *img_data) {
23 unsigned int h, w, s, xcs, ycs, bps;
24 unsigned int stride_in_bytes;
25 int align;
26
27 /* Treat align==0 like align==1 */
28 if (!buf_align) buf_align = 1;
29
30 /* Validate alignment (must be power of 2) */
31 if (buf_align & (buf_align - 1)) goto fail;
32
33 /* Treat align==0 like align==1 */
34 if (!stride_align) stride_align = 1;
35
36 /* Validate alignment (must be power of 2) */
37 if (stride_align & (stride_align - 1)) goto fail;
38
39 /* Get sample size for this format */
40 switch (fmt) {
41 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I420:
42 case VPX_IMG_FMT_YV12:
43 case VPX_IMG_FMT_NV12: bps = 12; break;
44 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I422:
45 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I440: bps = 16; break;
46 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I444: bps = 24; break;
47 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I42016: bps = 24; break;
48 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I42216:
49 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I44016: bps = 32; break;
50 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I44416: bps = 48; break;
51 default: bps = 16; break;
52 }
53
54 /* Get chroma shift values for this format */
55 // For VPX_IMG_FMT_NV12, xcs needs to be 0 such that UV data is all read at
56 // one time.
57 switch (fmt) {
58 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I420:
59 case VPX_IMG_FMT_YV12:
60 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I422:
61 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I42016:
62 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I42216: xcs = 1; break;
63 default: xcs = 0; break;
64 }
65
66 switch (fmt) {
67 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I420:
68 case VPX_IMG_FMT_NV12:
69 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I440:
70 case VPX_IMG_FMT_YV12:
71 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I42016:
72 case VPX_IMG_FMT_I44016: ycs = 1; break;
73 default: ycs = 0; break;
74 }
75
76 /* Calculate storage sizes. If the buffer was allocated externally, the width
77 * and height shouldn't be adjusted. */
78 w = d_w;
79 h = d_h;
80 s = (fmt & VPX_IMG_FMT_PLANAR) ? w : bps * w / 8;
81 s = (s + stride_align - 1) & ~(stride_align - 1);
82 stride_in_bytes = (fmt & VPX_IMG_FMT_HIGHBITDEPTH) ? s * 2 : s;
83
84 /* Allocate the new image */
85 if (!img) {
86 img = (vpx_image_t *)calloc(1, sizeof(vpx_image_t));
87
88 if (!img) goto fail;
89
90 img->self_allocd = 1;
91 } else {
92 memset(img, 0, sizeof(vpx_image_t));
93 }
94
95 img->img_data = img_data;
96
97 if (!img_data) {
98 uint64_t alloc_size;
99 /* Calculate storage sizes given the chroma subsampling */
100 align = (1 << xcs) - 1;
101 w = (d_w + align) & ~align;
102 align = (1 << ycs) - 1;
103 h = (d_h + align) & ~align;
104
105 s = (fmt & VPX_IMG_FMT_PLANAR) ? w : bps * w / 8;
106 s = (s + stride_align - 1) & ~(stride_align - 1);
107 stride_in_bytes = (fmt & VPX_IMG_FMT_HIGHBITDEPTH) ? s * 2 : s;
108 alloc_size = (fmt & VPX_IMG_FMT_PLANAR) ? (uint64_t)h * s * bps / 8
109 : (uint64_t)h * s;
110
111 if (alloc_size != (size_t)alloc_size) goto fail;
112
113 img->img_data = (uint8_t *)vpx_memalign(buf_align, (size_t)alloc_size);
114 img->img_data_owner = 1;
115 }
116
117 if (!img->img_data) goto fail;
118
119 img->fmt = fmt;
120 img->bit_depth = (fmt & VPX_IMG_FMT_HIGHBITDEPTH) ? 16 : 8;
121 img->w = w;
122 img->h = h;
123 img->x_chroma_shift = xcs;
124 img->y_chroma_shift = ycs;
125 img->bps = bps;
126
127 /* Calculate strides */
128 img->stride[VPX_PLANE_Y] = img->stride[VPX_PLANE_ALPHA] = stride_in_bytes;
129 img->stride[VPX_PLANE_U] = img->stride[VPX_PLANE_V] = stride_in_bytes >> xcs;
130
131 /* Default viewport to entire image */
132 if (!vpx_img_set_rect(img, 0, 0, d_w, d_h)) return img;
133
134fail:
135 vpx_img_free(img);
136 return NULL;
137}
138
139vpx_image_t *vpx_img_alloc(vpx_image_t *img, vpx_img_fmt_t fmt,
140 unsigned int d_w, unsigned int d_h,
141 unsigned int align) {
142 return img_alloc_helper(img, fmt, d_w, d_h, align, align, NULL);
143}
144
145vpx_image_t *vpx_img_wrap(vpx_image_t *img, vpx_img_fmt_t fmt, unsigned int d_w,
146 unsigned int d_h, unsigned int stride_align,
147 unsigned char *img_data) {
148 /* By setting buf_align = 1, we don't change buffer alignment in this
149 * function. */
150 return img_alloc_helper(img, fmt, d_w, d_h, 1, stride_align, img_data);
151}
152
153int vpx_img_set_rect(vpx_image_t *img, unsigned int x, unsigned int y,
154 unsigned int w, unsigned int h) {
155 unsigned char *data;
156
157 if (x + w <= img->w && y + h <= img->h) {
158 img->d_w = w;
159 img->d_h = h;
160
161 /* Calculate plane pointers */
162 if (!(img->fmt & VPX_IMG_FMT_PLANAR)) {
163 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_PACKED] =
164 img->img_data + x * img->bps / 8 + y * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_PACKED];
165 } else {
166 const int bytes_per_sample =
167 (img->fmt & VPX_IMG_FMT_HIGHBITDEPTH) ? 2 : 1;
168 data = img->img_data;
169
170 if (img->fmt & VPX_IMG_FMT_HAS_ALPHA) {
171 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_ALPHA] =
172 data + x * bytes_per_sample + y * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_ALPHA];
173 data += img->h * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_ALPHA];
174 }
175
176 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_Y] =
177 data + x * bytes_per_sample + y * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_Y];
178 data += img->h * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_Y];
179
180 if (img->fmt == VPX_IMG_FMT_NV12) {
181 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_U] =
182 data + (x >> img->x_chroma_shift) +
183 (y >> img->y_chroma_shift) * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_U];
184 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_V] = img->planes[VPX_PLANE_U] + 1;
185 } else if (!(img->fmt & VPX_IMG_FMT_UV_FLIP)) {
186 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_U] =
187 data + (x >> img->x_chroma_shift) * bytes_per_sample +
188 (y >> img->y_chroma_shift) * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_U];
189 data += (img->h >> img->y_chroma_shift) * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_U];
190 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_V] =
191 data + (x >> img->x_chroma_shift) * bytes_per_sample +
192 (y >> img->y_chroma_shift) * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_V];
193 } else {
194 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_V] =
195 data + (x >> img->x_chroma_shift) * bytes_per_sample +
196 (y >> img->y_chroma_shift) * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_V];
197 data += (img->h >> img->y_chroma_shift) * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_V];
198 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_U] =
199 data + (x >> img->x_chroma_shift) * bytes_per_sample +
200 (y >> img->y_chroma_shift) * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_U];
201 }
202 }
203 return 0;
204 }
205 return -1;
206}
207
208void vpx_img_flip(vpx_image_t *img) {
209 /* Note: In the calculation pointer adjustment calculation, we want the
210 * rhs to be promoted to a signed type. Section 6.3.1.8 of the ISO C99
211 * standard indicates that if the adjustment parameter is unsigned, the
212 * stride parameter will be promoted to unsigned, causing errors when
213 * the lhs is a larger type than the rhs.
214 */
215 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_Y] += (signed)(img->d_h - 1) * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_Y];
216 img->stride[VPX_PLANE_Y] = -img->stride[VPX_PLANE_Y];
217
218 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_U] += (signed)((img->d_h >> img->y_chroma_shift) - 1) *
219 img->stride[VPX_PLANE_U];
220 img->stride[VPX_PLANE_U] = -img->stride[VPX_PLANE_U];
221
222 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_V] += (signed)((img->d_h >> img->y_chroma_shift) - 1) *
223 img->stride[VPX_PLANE_V];
224 img->stride[VPX_PLANE_V] = -img->stride[VPX_PLANE_V];
225
226 img->planes[VPX_PLANE_ALPHA] +=
227 (signed)(img->d_h - 1) * img->stride[VPX_PLANE_ALPHA];
228 img->stride[VPX_PLANE_ALPHA] = -img->stride[VPX_PLANE_ALPHA];
229}
230
231void vpx_img_free(vpx_image_t *img) {
232 if (img) {
233 if (img->img_data && img->img_data_owner) vpx_free(img->img_data);
234
235 if (img->self_allocd) free(img);
236 }
237}
